de·mis·ing.definition: to convey (possession of property) by will or lease [thepremises]n  [Anglo-French, from feminine past participle ofto convey by lease, from Old French, to put down, give up, renounce, from Latinto let fall andto release]
de·mis·ing.demettre: to convey by lease, from Old French, to put down, give up, renounce, from Latin

1.definition: the conveyance of property by will or lease

2.definition: the transmission of property by testate or intestate succession

3.definition: charter of a boat in which the owner surrenders completely the possession, command, and navigation of the boat called also
